name: Equalize Prices Again
description:
You are both a shop keeper and a shop assistant at a small nearby shop. You
have 
    n
 goods, the 
    i
-th good costs 
    a_i
 coins. You got tired
of remembering the price of each product when customers ask for it, thus you
decided to simplify your life. More precisely you decided to set the same
price for all 
    n
 goods you have. However, you don't want to lose any
money so you want to choose the price in such a way that the sum of new prices
is not less than the sum of the initial prices. It means that if you sell all

    n
 goods for the new price, you will receive at least the same (or
greater) amount of money as if you sell them for their initial prices. On the
other hand, you don't want to lose customers because of big prices so among
all prices you can choose you need to choose the minimum one. So you need to
find the minimum possible equal price of all 
    n
 goods so if you sell them
for this price, you will receive at least the same (or greater) amount of
money as if you sell them for their initial prices. You have to answer 
    q

independent queries. Input The first line of the input contains one integer

    q
 (
    1 
    ≤ q 
    ≤ 100
) — the number of queries. Then 
    q

queries follow. The first line of the query contains one integer 
    n
 (
    1
    
    ≤ n 
    ≤ 100)
 — the number of goods. The second line of the query
contains 
    n
 integers 
    a_1, a_2, 
    …, a_n
 (
    1 
    ≤ a_i 
    ≤
    10^7
), where 
    a_i
 is the price of the 
    i
-th good. Output For each
query, print the answer for it — the minimum possible equal price of all

    n
 goods so if you sell them for this price, you will receive at least
the same (or greater) amount of money as if you sell them for their initial
prices. Example Input 3 5 1 2 3 4 5 3 1 2 2 4 1 1 1 1 Output 3 2 1
